Class Controller

java.lang.Object
com.example.demo.controller.Controller
public class Controller extends Object
The Controller class serves as the central hub for managing the game's stages, levels, and transitions between different scenes such as the main menu, game levels, and settings page. It coordinates the flow of the application and provides methods to initialize, clean up, and navigate between scenes.

  • Field Details

    • stage

      private javafx.stage.Stage stage
      The primary JavaFX Stage used to display the current scene.

    • currentLevel

      private LevelParent currentLevel
      The current game level being played, represented as a LevelParent object. It holds the active level and manages its lifecycle.

    • mainMenu

      private MainMenu mainMenu
      The main menu scene, represented as a MainMenu object. This is the entry point to the game.

    • settingsPage

      private SettingsPage settingsPage
      The settings page scene, represented as a SettingsPage object. This allows the user to adjust game settings.

  • Constructor Details

    • Controller

      public Controller(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
      Constructs a Controller instance and initializes the application with the main menu displayed by default.
      Parameters:
      stage - the primary stage used to display scenes

  • Method Details

    • getSettingsPage

      public SettingsPage getSettingsPage()
      Returns the settings page of the application.
      Returns:
      the SettingsPage object

    • getStage

      public javafx.stage.Stage getStage()
      Returns the primary stage of the application.
      Returns:
      the primary Stage object

    • showMainMenu

      public void showMainMenu()
      Displays the main menu scene. A new MainMenu object is created each time this method is called, ensuring a fresh scene.

    • launchGame

      public void launchGame()
      Starts the game by transitioning to the first level.

    • goToLevel

      private void goToLevel(String className)
      Transitions to a specified game level. Dynamically loads the class corresponding to the level and initializes it.
      Parameters:
      className - the fully qualified name of the level class

    • returnToMainMenu

      public void returnToMainMenu()
      Returns to the main menu from the current level. Ensures the current level is cleaned up properly.

    • exitGame

      public void exitGame()
      Closes the application by exiting the primary stage.

    • handleException

      private void handleException(Exception e)
      Handles exceptions that may occur during runtime. Currently, it prints the stack trace of the exception.
      Parameters:
      e - the exception to handle
